content: Yes, PLJ, it should. That was the point. And IS the point of satire. To make people squirm. And, then, to act. To wit: Satire is, by definition, offensive. It is meant to make us feel uncomfortable. It is meant to make us scratch our heads, think, do a double-take, and then think again. — Maajid Nawaz And why did you believe she was better than her Dad? He is an imbecile and possibly mentally ill. And she is colluding with him. If she was better than him, sane, she would have called him out, or divorced herself from him, or refused to be part of his absurd fantasy-filled administration, or supported Hillary, or another candidate. It is easy to make the case that she is even worse, not better than her father. Responsible adults should know better. I live in NYC. Here, we all know that the Trump family has been notoriously corrupt, as well as notoriously anti-Semitic, for generations. Do you think I am not aware that the language I put in Ivanka’s mouth in this post is horribly offensive to Jews and Gentiles?? I do know it. Well. So I’m glad you wrote, PLJ, and that you got that taste in your mouth. And, if I can manage it tomorrow, I’ll do it again. So bring some Listerine. Thanks for reading. I always do appreciate you and your comments, PLJ. –AI
